page.title: 13ECOLOGY
page.content: The bats usually live in horizontal galleries leading of from the main shaft. The bat population has dropped by 98% since 1950 and there was thought to be about 200 pairs left in{ {Cornwall.}There were nearly 200 pairs of Horseshoe bats found living in Wheal Buttry near{Bissoe.}The bats leave the shaft in a spiralling flight. A special capping was made to stop cattle from falling in, to warn humans of the shaft and let the bats spiral out. The cover and iron framing have to be 75cm to leave room for the bats to spiral out. The bat flaps cannot be painted because bats don't like paint so they use special Iron bars. There are 3 bat flaps at{ {Creegbrawse}near the School.
